You know the answer to that. You used to handle those jobs yourself. Fallon pats him on the shoulder. FALLON (CONT’D) Think about your boy, Jack. I'm sure you'll do the right thing. He steps out as we STAY ON Jack’s devastated reaction.

And then he sees his son as well. He struggles to his fee Palmiotti comes to finish him off. But in his haste he is watching for Jack’s left hook. And it’s a beauty. Palmiot is rocked as the crowd ROARS. Jack throws a brutal series combinations until--Palmiotti hits the canvas!

Jack smiles to his beaming son. But then he looks to wher Fallon and his men were sitting. They’re already gone.
As Jack steps out of the back door to see a black stretch limousine waiting. He doesn’t bother trying to.run. Inste he just bows his head. And waits.

Lenny Bruce once said that in the halls of justice, the only justice is out in the halls. But today you can change all that. Because today you are justice. A petite but tough-looking girl is sitting beside Matt's partner, FRANKLIN “FOGGY” NELSON.

I'm so glad we've found this time to sit down together, Mr. Urich. We PULL BACK from the Buddha to reveal a MASSIVE MAN sitt across the table from the reporter. WILSON FISK. Let‘s talk about the dirt. Fisk chuckles.
Have you ever heard of the Kingpin? Fisk's smile fades slightly.
Of course. My father used to tell me stories about the Kingpin when I was a child. How one man ruled all of the crime in New York City. Preposterous. Wesley nods, echoing his words: “preposterous.”

Tomorrow. Noon. Fisk glances at his reflection in the window.
If the press wants a Kingpin, I'll give them a Kingpin. On a silver platter. He lights a Cuban cigar. FISK (CONT’D) Get me Bullseye.
MUSIC UP: MEET THE CREEPER by Rob Zombie As the racehorses are released from their starting gates.

...and Gimme Some Sugar jumps into the lead...it‘s Gimme Some Sugar followed by King Kirby and Excelsior... Amongst the CACOPHONY OF NOISE we single out a MAN sittin close to the track. He wears a long, blue leather coat an his head is shorn clean like a bullet. CAMERA SLOWLY SWIN AROUND HIM to reveal the TATTOO on the back of his head. A BULL’S-EYE.
It‘s Gimme Some Sugar and Excelsior... Gimme Some Sugar and Excelsior rounding the corner with King Kirby in third...
Bang! Bang! Bullseye turns to see a LITTLE BOY sitting beside him. He wears a cowboy hat and shoots at the horses with a cap gu
My Dad let me bet five dollars! I picked the black one with the spot on his nose!
You don’t say? (CONTINUED)

It's Gimme Some Sugar pulling ahead... Gimme Some Sugar and Excelsior... A WAITRESS steps over with a glass of wine. And as she se it down Bullseye reaches over and “accidentally” knocks i off the table. The wine glass SHATTERS as red Cabernet bleeds across the white cement floor.

Oh dear. I'11 be right back to clean that up for you... And as she turns to leave Bullseye holds up the STEM OF T BROKEN WINE GLASS; it's jagged end is as sharp as a knife He looks over to the Boy and holds his finger to his lips

Its Gimme Some Sugar by a length! Gimme Some Sugar heading for the stretch! Bullseye suddenly spins and WHIPS the glass stem out into track piercing the neck of the lead Jockey! The Jockey fa to the track where he’s TRAMPLED by the other horses!

OH MY! Gimme Some Sugar’s jockey is down! A jockey is down! And now it’s Excelsior at the finish! Paramedics rush to the rider as Excelsior crosses the fin line. It’s the black one with the spot on his nose.
It’s Excelsior followed by King Kirby in second and Saving Grace in third! Bullseye smiles back at the Little Boy.
Looks like your lucky day. He winks and “shoots” back at the Little Boy with his fin as his PAGER goes off. He checks the message before turni and disappearing into the crowd. CcuT TO:  28.
A photo of Josie’s with the headline: BARROOM BLITZ-KRIEG Below that, in much smaller letters, with the photo of a girl named LISA TaAZIO.
As we reveal Foggy and Matt sitting with their morning coffee. Foggy reads Matt the story:
‘...police are still investigating.’ (looks up) I bet they are. Check this out. (reading) ‘Witnesses say Quesada and Smith were singled out by the demonic vigilante known as Daredevil.’
Here we go again...
Wait, it gets better. (reading) ‘A policeman on the scene reports that the suspect flew’--got that?--‘flew down the subway tunnel to make his escape.'
It’s the Post, Foggy. That’s one step up from the National Enquirer.
There must be something to these stories. We've been hearing them for years.
Yeah, like the alligators that live in the sewers.
That's true about the alligators. I’m serious. I got a friend in sanitation. Foggy smiles at an artist’s rendering of Daredevil. It lo like something out of H.R. Geiger. (CONTINUED)

FOGGY (cont'd) I don’t know what scares me more--that the Devil has come to New York or that some nut job is dressing up ina Halloween costume to fight crime. (chuckles) I’d hate to see that guy’s therapy bills.
(smile fading) Yeah...
Speaking of bills, we got our first payment from Mr. Lee this morning. Matt knows what's coming and tries to change the subject.
Great. Could you pass the sugar? Foggy unscrews the lid on the SALT SHAKER and slides it o
Actually, it’ not great. He paid us in fluke. That's a fish, Matt. Did you know that? Because I sure didn’t.
He goes fishing on weekends.
And I go salsa dancing. But you don’t see me offering to dance for my bills.
And a grateful city thanks you. Matt pours the salt into his coffee.
We can’t keep taking these pro bono cases. We need better clients. Foggy squirts ketchup into the creamer.
Define “better.”
Guilty rich people. Cream? (CONTINUED)
{taking it) Remember what we talked about in college? How we wanted to make a difference?
I remember. I just thought that we would’ve sold out by now. Matt pours the ketchup/creamer into his salted coffee. Bu before he drinks it he suddenly turns and SNIFFS the air.
Mmmm... Foggy’s seen this before.
Where-where-where?

Behind you. Foggy looks over his shoulder to see... ELEKTRA NATCHIOS. An exotic beauty with a wild mane of black hair. Her body equal parts muscle and sensuality. And although she’s dressed casually (low-slung hip-huggers, baby doll t-shir belly ring) she still has the aura of privilege about her
Tell me.
You want the truth?
And nothing but.

She's hideous. Matt grins. He knows Foggy’s lying, of course. Foggy pick up a spoon and uses it to check his reflection. And as he does Matt deftly swi i . FOGGY (cont'd) As your attorney in this matter I must advise against any further action. Foggy puts the spoon down to see--Matt’s already gone. (CONTINUED)
using his cane like a normal blind man as he steps across cafe. He ‘accidentally’ bumps into Elektra‘s table.
Excuse me. Elektra never looks up from her Village Voice.
Sure.
Seems every time I get the lay of the land here they rearrange the furniture.
I was looking for some sugar.
Right in front of you.
Could you be more specific?
What are you--? And then she looks up and freezes.
(helpfully) ‘Blind?’
Oh! Oh, I‘m so sorry I...here... She holds up the sugar and places it in his hands. And as she does Matt touches her hand and smiles.
Funny. I can’t tell where the sugar ends and you begin. A LONG BEAT as Elektra looks him over.
Does that line actually work for you? (CONTINUED)
Foggy CHUCKLES before sipping his coffee--and BLOWING IT across the table! Matt bites his lip to keep from laughin ELEKTRA (CONT’D) (glancing over) Friend of yours?
Never seen him before. She finally laughs.
(offering his hand) Matt Murdock. (taking it) Nice to meet you, Matt Murdock. And then she gets up and starts for the door.
Wait. I didn’t get your name. She glances back.
That's because I didn't give it. She walks out of the coffee shop as Foggy hoots:
Matt smiles ruefully. And then he grabs his cane.
Hey...where you going?
To file an appeal.
We have to be at the courthouse at twelve o’clock. I'm not going to wait for you.
I‘1l be there.
Twelve o’clock! (CONTINUED)
He walks out the door as Foggy shakes his head.
Poor guy doesn’t have a clue... And then he absent-mindedly sips his coffee--and BLOWS IT across the table for the second time as we CuT TO:
As Matt tracks Elektra’s scent through the park. He walks past a large oak tree as a BREEZE RUSTLES through the lea momentarily scattering the trail when:
What do you want?
as Matt whirls around to reveal Elektra with her arms crossed. She looks pissed.
I just wanted to know your name.
I don’t like being followed. So don’t. She turns to leave. Matt reaches for her arm. Bad idea.
Hey wait-- She expertly SNATCHES his wrist in a Kenpo lock.
And I don’t like being touched.
Why don’t you tell me what you do like and we'll start from there? Matt suddenly collapses her hold and reverses their hands into a classic Wuxia guard. Elektra reacts, surprised.
How did you do that?
Ancient Chinese secret. (CONTINUED)
She offers a little smile and deflects his guard before lashing out with an iron claw. Matt cross-blocks it.
That’s a shao-lin technique.
So is this. She backs him up with a succession of STRIKES AND LUNGES. Her style is graceful and deadly; ballet meets Kung Fu.
(sensing) You're holding back...
Yes.
Don’t. She ups the attack. They circle each other as a HOMELESS stops to watch this bizarre show.
What are you? A sensei?
Nope. A lawyer.
Kick his ass! Elektra laughs and doubles-up her attack. The fight is ‘growing more intense--but also more playful. Sexual even They sense each other’s every move--like fighting a mirro
All this just to get your name?
Try asking for my number. She drives Matt back until he PUSHES OFF a park bench and wraps her arms. He‘’s got her beat. And she knows it.
I never fall for the same move twice.
I‘11 remember that. (CONTINUED)
He releases her. Elektra finally offers her hand.
Elektra Natchios. Matt takes it. In a split-second she FLIPS HIM to the gro and holds a two-fingered strike to his windpipe. A BEAT.
So can I call you? She smiles. And then she starts to laugh as we CuT TO: Matt and Elektra walking through the park together.
Who did you train with?
It was always changing. My father had me study with a different sensei every year since I was five years old.
Sounds like he wanted to turn you into some kind of warrior.
No. Just not a victim. (changing the subject) What about you? How does a blind man learn to fight like that?

(a la “Karate Kid”) “Wax on...wax off...” She laughs and punches him in the arm as Matt winces. Dam she's strong. We hear a car horn HONKING as she turns to a black limousine pulling up along the road. She SIGHS.
He always finds me.
Who?
Stavros. I thought I lost him at the cafe. But I swear he’s part bloodhound. (CONTINUED)
A BIG GREEK steps out of the limousine.
(pointing to his watch) Pame, Elektra.
(muttering) Malakas.
Little help for the blind guy? Elektra laughs.
Stavros is my bodyguard.
You need a bodyguard?
My father can be a little over- protective at times. ~
(realizing) Natchios as in Nikolas Natchios?
That’s Dad. The horn HONKS again. ELERTRA (CONT’D) I really do have to go.
How will I find you if you won't give me your number?

You won’t. She leans over and kisses Matt's cheek. ELEKTRA (CONT‘D) I‘ll find you. She walks off as we CLOSE ON Matt’s smile. But then he -_ reaches for his wristwatch and flips up the glass lid. He feels the BRAILLE FACE and winces. (CONTINUED)
Shit.
As WE TRACK Matt and Foggy down the hallway together...
‘Don’t be late.’ Those were my last words...
I’m sorry.
I told you I wouldn’t wait.
But you did wait.
Wha--that’s not the point.
I said I was sorry. What do you want?
Details. You owe me that.
Her name is Elektra Natchios.
Sounds like a Mexican appetizer.
It’s Greek, Brainiac. Her father’s Nikolas Natchios, the shipping heir.
And I’m Ted Kennedy’s love child.
That explains a lot, actually.
You: know, you’re pretty funny for a blind guy...
Where VINCENT CORDOZA is handcuffed to a ringlet on the w Tattoos on his neck, his knuckles, a jail yard stare. He looks up as the doors opens and Matt and Foggy step insid
The hell are you?
We're your lawyers. If you're innocent. (beat) So are you? Innocent? We slowly CLOSE ON Cordoza as Matt listens in...
Hell ya... We PUSH THROUGH his chest to reveal his HEART BEATING. unlike with Quesada, his heart is rock steady.
Hell ya... We PULL OUT and WHIP PAN to Matt’s reaction.
I believe you.
(surprised) You do?
You do? Matt offers his hand out to Cordoza.
You‘ve got yourself a defense. Foggy buries his face in his hands as we And
Amidst the pedestrian traffic we find Foggy and Matt walk down the sidewalk together holding Styrofoam cups of coff (CONTINUED)
I wonder what Cordoza will pay us in? Free tattoos? Malt liquor?
Foggy...
He’s a three-time loser that was found holding the murder weapon a block away.
He’s also innocent.
How can you be so sure?
Have I ever been wrong?
...no. Which is really annoying, by the way. Foggy stops and checks his clipboard. FOGGY (CONT’D) Okay. We're here. Lisa Tazio’s apartment . They stop before a small walk~up next to a Korean mini-ma
What was Tazio doing out here at one o'clock in the morning?
(checking his notes) Coming home from night class.
At one o'clock in the morning?

So it was a late night class. Look, I know you‘ve got this built-in bullshit detector, but this time it’s on the blink. I mean, why would somebody go to all this trouble just to cover-up the murder of a college girl? (CONTINUED)
We can’t answer that until we find out more about Lisa Tazio.
I don't like the sound of this... INT. LISA TAZIO’S APARTMENT - NIGHT CLICK. Matt picks the lock as they step inside.
I must've been sick the day they taught that. Real estate law, right?
What do you see?
Small, bachelorette apartment. Nice kitchen. Fireplace. Exposed brick. You think they’ve already rented this place?
Foggy.

What? I might as well get something out of this case. (looking around) College textbooks. Diet Coke. Lots of Diet Coke. Computer. Village Voice. A college student, like the report said. Matt inhales the room.
Ammonia. Someone cleaned this place out. He stops at the desk and feels the computer.
Want me to turn it on?
Don’t bother. I‘m sure everything's already been erased. Matt places his hands over the pine desktop. (CONTINUED)
There's nothing there, Matt.
as Matt’s finger pads touch the surface of the desk. They brush over the slightest indentation in the wood.
Give me some paper. And a marker. Foggy takes both from his clipboard and hands them over.
What are you doing?

She wrote a note with a ball point pen. The impression is still in the wood. Matt lays the paper over the desk and runs the marker ove it. Like magic, the marker shades everything except for t indented letters: MARK WELCH 6301000.
What do we got?
(smiling) A name and a phone number. Suddenly the TELEPHONE RINGS. They look to each other.
You gonna get that? Matt smirks. The answering machine picks up:
Hi, this is Sexy Sadie...
Oh Jesus. We broke into the wrong house--
Shhh.
--if you want to help me study, leave your name and number at the beep. I'11 help you straighten out your Longfellow. (CONTINUED)

Hi, um, I saw your ad in the paper and I'd like to make an...appointment. I’m at 328-1020. Um, bye. Matt feels a button on the answering machine and presses while Foggy grabs the Village Voice and rifles through it BEEP. SECOND MAN’S VOICE Sexy Sadie, it’s your favorite professor. I’m staying at the Plaza. How’s tomorrow after midnight? Bring the ruler.
Check this out... CU VILLAGE VOICE CLASSIFIEDS. A shot of a sexy girl busting out of a sorority sweater i one of those call girl ads in the back. It’s Lisa Tazio.
College girl by day, call girl by night.
Lisa Tazio wasn’t coming home at one e’clock in the morning.
(catching on) She was going out...
And somebody was waiting. We CLOSE ON the desk top: MARK WELCH 6301000.

A CIGARETTE BUTT is flicked onto the sidewalk. We follow wisp of smoke up to the face of... BEN URICH. He drives off down the street. And as goes we TILT UP to the lights of an AIRPLANE flying overhead.
Where we meet a SWEET OLD LADY flying to New York. She’s knitting while she talks. And talks. And talks...

..-and then my daughter, Susie, not the Susie from Buffalo--that’s my son Larry's daughter from his first marriage, eloped with a semi-colored fellah from Long Island. What's that word? Mulatta? Let's just say he’s got a little cream in his coffee. Anyhow he does very well for himself on that internet. Don’t ask me to explain. They got me a computer last year for Christmas but I won't use it because I'm afraid it'll start a fire... The CAMERA slowly PULLS BACK to reveal...

sitting in the seat next to her. He’s listening to Korn's TWIST on his Walkman. BULLSEYE’S POV The old lady’s lips move as the sound of DEATH METAL come out of her mouth. He finally takes the headphones out.
...and do you know what she said to me?
Would-you-shut-the-fuck-up?

(without blinking) No, she said: “Come and visit, Mom.” But who can afford to fly these days? Bullseye puts his headphones back on as a flight attendan walks by and drops a bag of airline peanuts onto his tray Bullseye opens the tiny bag and three peanuts total roll SWEET OLD LADY (cont’d) But then my sister Florence called from St. Paul...
as Bullseye rolls it under his forefinger on the tray... (CONTINUED)

SWEET OLD LADY (cont’d) ...and she said she has frequent flier miles that she can’t use on account of her sciatic nerve acting up-- And then he FLICKS it into the seat before him. The peanu RICOCHETS off of the seat and INTO the Old Lady’s mouth! SWEET OLD LADY (cont‘d) ..-and I said--ACCCCKK! The old lady CHOKES on the peanut, until nothing comes ou her mouth except for an empty GASP. Buliseye watches as h eyes bulge out in horror--until she finally collapses bac into her chair. A BEAT. The Flight Attendant comes by and sets a blanket onto the ‘sleeping’ old lady's lap.
Can I get you anything before we land? Bullseye smiles.
More peanuts?
CLOSE-UP Matt as he addresses the jury:

Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, I’m not going to tell you that vincent Cordoza is a model citizen. He’s been in and out of reform schools and prisons since he was twelve years old, But this isn’t a court of character--it’s a court of law. And in this case Vincent Cordoza is innocent.
All of whom appear ill-at-ease. And as we PULL BACK into courtroom we see why: Matt is facing the wrong way.
as he whispers to Foggy:
He‘s facing the wrong way. (CONTINUED)
Don't worry. Matt’s got ‘em right where he wants ‘em.
Right...
as she suddenly stops and turns back to the jury.
Just kidding. The jury LAUGHS. They love him. But not the no-nonsense JUDGE. She’s clearly seen this trick of his before.
Does this defense come with a two-drink minimum, Mr. Murdock?
No Your Honor. I just wanted to show the jury what it's been like for Vincent Cordoza. Like talking to a wall. Matt steps before the jury as he concludes:

But today his story will be heard. Today the truth comes out. And with your help, justice will be found. Thank you. Foggy steps over to help guide Matt back to his seat. May overkill, but the jury doesn’t know that.
On the witness stand. He’s clean-cut, honest-looking, as answers the Prosecutor's questions:

We were a block away when we got the call of shots being fired. When we arrived on the scene Miss Tazio was lying dead on the steps of her apartment. We found Cordoza in the alley, incoherent, and still holding the murder weapon... Foggy sighs. This is not going to be easy. He glances to the back of the courtroom. (CONTINUED)
Wonder what he’s doing here?
Who?
to reveal Ben Urich sitting down. Watching the trial..
That Daredevil reporter from the Post. Now it’s Matt’s turn to look rattled...

Matt steps down the sidewalk for home when we hear FOOTST behind him. The footsteps GROW CLOSER. He turns the corne towards his apartment. Tenses as the footsteps follow. Bu then he catches an intoxicating scent and stops.
Does this mean you want a re-match? The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal...
standing behind him on the sidewalk.
How did you know I wasn’t a mugger?
Muggers don’t smell like Chanel No. 5. She smiles.
I was in the neighborhood.
On purpose? Elektra LAUGHS.
I told you I'd find you...
(CONTINUED)
walking through the sidewalks of the Kitchen at night, sharing a slice of real New York pizza. ELEKTRA (CONT’D) I've died and gone to heaven...
Yeah. Thank God there are still some places where you can’t find a Pizza Hut.
You really love it here, don’t you? Matt smiles and nods.

The Kitchen’s like family. Sometimes it’s the Manson Family-- She laughs. : MATT (CONT’D) Co --but we all look out for each other. Watch your step here... She takes his arm as they walk around an open sewer grate ‘ ELEKTRA Thanks, I didn’t see-- (she stops, reacts) ' How do you do that?

After you take a few headers onto the sidewalk you tend to remember where the ' hazards are. Elektra smiles as she breathes in the night. We notice sh \ still hasn't let go of his arm. Matt notices too. Smile i ELEKTRA ' It’s nice to have history some place. I ' feel like I'm always shuttling between planes and hotels and countries. There’s : a ball tomorrow night at my father’s hotel that I’m absolutely dreading. o MATT \ So don’t go. (CONTINUED)
It‘s not that simple. My father needs me. We're all we have left. Matt suddenly looks up to the sky.
Did you bring an umbrella?
Why? Suddenly, THUNDER BOOMS as the rain begins to come.
Come on! Elektra ducks under an awning in the alley, laughing. But Matt stays out in the rain, welcoming it like an old frie
You’re getting soaked!

You know what a nice day is? When there's a breeze. Scraps of leaves and paper dance down the sidewalks giving me a world of detail I'd usually miss... (smiling) But a perfect day is when it rains. We hear the MUTED PATTER of the raindrops now, hitting th leaves overhead, as Elektra listens to Matt’s world.
Suddenly there's a roof to the universe ..and everything that was shapeless is given contours and textures... He stops and inhales the world around him. *
Car exhaust washes away replaced by the * smell of earth and grass...and for a *
moment everything is clear...

Where we see the rain visualized as DROPS OF SOUND. Elekt steps closer as they bounce off of her shoulders, her hai the bridge of her nose, until they reveal her in a perfec Silhouette. She's even more beautiful than he imagined. ae ee (CONTINUED)
For a moment...I can see again.
As she takes his hand and places it on her face.
as Matt slowly caresses her delicate features, the raindr streaming between his fingers and her cheeks in rivulets.
You are so beautiful. They start to kiss. Matt losing himself in the moment... And then the VOICES start. The VOICES that only Matt Murdock can hear.
Take the watch! Just don’t hurt me!
Crank? Base? Watchoo want, mistah? Cuz I got ‘em all.
Take the money outta the register! Matt grits his teeth.
No...
What is it?
Nothing...

Matt? Matt grimaces. Determined to shut them out. But then we hear the voice of a LITTLE BOY crying. LITTLE BOY‘S VOICE Please! Please don’t hurt me! ABUSIVE FATHER’S VOICE Don't you run from me, boy! (CONTINUED)
And he can’t shut them out anymore.
I have to go.
Matt?
I’m sorry... Matt hurries off as we STAY ON Elektra’s puzzled reaction
Matt rips open his shirt to reveal the CRIMSON DOUBLE D o the costume he wears underneath. His face a mask of rage.
One night. That's all I wanted. One Goddamn night to myself...
as it's snapped apart into Daredevil’s billy club. It’s folded and holstered as we TILT UP to the face of DAREDEV
Say your prayers, asshole.
An ABUSIVE FATHER stumbles down the hallway with greasy h hanging over bloodshot eyes. His voice is thick, drugged.

He pulls the belt from his pants and SLAPS it against the walls as he goes. He stops to see the WINDOW IS OPEN. ABUSIVE FATHER (CONT’D) Did I say you could open this window? You little son of a bitch? We hear WHIMPERING coming from under the stairs. The Fath stumbles over and yanks the LITTLE BOY out before throwin him up against the wall. The boy covers his ears, CRYING. (CONTINUED)

head_text.subj: LISTEN WHEN I TALK TO YOU

text: He raises his belt over his head when--Daredevil’s gloved hand comes into frame and grabs him by the wrist! ABUSIVE FATHER (CONT‘D) What--? Daredevil TWISTS his arm and CRACKS it at the elbow! The Father HOWLS IN PAIN as he crumples to his knees.
See how it feels?
I‘11 kill you, motherf--!
Wrong answer. He GRABS him by the neck and YANKS him up off the floor, shouting at him in the man’s own words: DAREDEVIL (CONT’D) ‘LISTEN-WHEN-I-TALK-TO-YOU! ’ Daredevil’s about to go off when:
The Little Boy grabs Daredevil’s arm.
Don’t hurt my Dad! Daredevil stops. A BEAT. And then he lets the Father drop to the ground. The Little Boy holds his Father, SOBBING, Daredevil stands there, unsure.
I’m not the bad guy, kid... But it’s more of a plea than a statement. Daredevil turns and slips out of the dark room as we CuT TO:
Where Matt stands overlooking the city. His hood pulled b from his face. Looking sick of the life that he’s created (CONTINUED)
I'm not the bad guy...
Their offices are right in between a yellow “CHECKS CASHE sign and a Korean pet service named “U WASH DOGGY.”
As we meet their secretary/receptionist KAREN PAGE. She's beautiful, wholesome~looking blond who has a thing for Ma which we can sense from the moment he steps in.
Hi, Matt. You got some messages. I typed them into your braille printer.
Thanks, Karen. Foggy steps out of his office as Karen hands Matt a fancy gold-embossed invitation.
And this came by messenger this morning. It‘s your invitation to the Black and White Ball at the Grand. Plus one. She smiles, clearly wanting to be asked.
Plus one? Sweet. Foggy snatches the invitation as Karen glares.
Would you like some coffee?
I’m fine, thanks. Matt walks into his office. Foggy holds up his empty cup.
I'd like coffee. Karen just walks back to her desk. (CONTINUED)

FOGGY (CONT’D) O-kay... INT. MATT’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS The office is crowded with junk--remote control sailboats leisure suits, boxes of shoes, all from the pro bono case the past. Matt steps in and hits a button on a BRAILLE PRINTER as his COURT TRANSCRIPTS begin printing out.
(reading the invite) How'd you rate? This is the toughest ticket in town.
I don’t know. What'd you find on our mystery man?
Mark Welch? Nothing. No records. No priors. That phone number is a disconnect. It’s like he never existed. Now about this party tonight--
I’m not going.
What? Are you crazy? That place will be crawling with rich people. The kind of people who don’t pay their fees in fish.
Then you go.
I‘ma Plus One. Plus Ones can’t get into anything by themselves. (stops) This is about Elektra, isn’t it?
No.
That‘s it. Natchios owns the Grand. She's the one who invited you. This is getting serious, isn’t it? (CONTINUED)
Not exactly. I blew it last night.
What happened? Foggy picks up a Nerf basketball from Matt’s desk.
It‘s hard to explain... Foggy shoots but hits the rim.
Karen said it was messengered this Morning. So at least one of you isn’t giving up so easily. Ball. Foggy tosses him the Nerf ball. Matt throws a perfect SWI
I don't wanna talk about it.
Right. God forbid you share anything personal with your best friend. Foggy shoots again, this time missing completely.
Swish. Matt smirks. FOGGY (CONT’D) Look, can I speak to you as your friend for a second and not as a whore monger?
Only if it’s for a second.

That whole love-at-first-sight thing? Never happened to me. I always thought it was some crap Hallmark invented to push product on Valentine’s Day. Until I saw you two in that coffee shop. Ball. Matt catches the Nerf ball as he thinks that over.
Plus One, huh? (CONTINUED)
Foggy grins. Matt hits nothin’ but net as we...
A luxurious old-time hotel along the lines of the St. Reg or the Plaza. Matt and Foggy make their way through.
Do you know how much money is here tonight? One new client and we could be set for a year. Matt suddenly catches a WHIFF OF CIGARETTE SMOKE as:
Matt Murdock?
to reveal Ben Urich stepping over. Matt tenses.
Ben Urich with the Post. They shake hands.
This is my partner Franklin Nelson.
That's “N-e-l-s-o-n.”
You were at the Cordoza trial.
That's right.
You're covering it for the paper?
No. Not really. Curious, that’s all. Urich offers them his business card. URICH (CONT’D) Here's my number. Give me a call if anything comes up. (CONTINUED)

But as he does he accidentally knocks Matt’s RED CANE out his hands. It hits the floor with a CLATTER. URICH (CONT’D) Sorry. Urich picks it back up, noticing... URICH (CONT’D) Interesting color. Matt quickly takes it away.
I wouldn’t know. But then Matt stops as he hears the sound of a heavy BASS HEARTBEAT approaching. A HUGE SHADOW falls over them as:
I didn’t expect to see you here, Mr. Urich. to reveal Wilson Fisk. Wesley is at his side, as always.
